ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Planetary formation, solar system formation, physics of Earth's interior, dynamics of convection, seismology

Formation of the solar system and planets.
Properties, parameters and techniques we can use to understand the structure, history and evolution of planets and the solar system.
Insights into important questions and issues of planetary science; different hypothesis and studies on those questions and the evaluation of those theories.
How Earth materials behave under different conditions and how will they affect our observations of Earth.

By taking this course, I enhanced my knowledge of geophysics and applied physics in general. This course was deeply helpful in bolstering my understanding of how the earth formed and the geologic processes thereafter.
This course helped me become a better science reader, as homework required me to digest papers quickly and thoroughly.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: focussed on qualitative understanding of concepts and equations, included stories of the scientists who studied what the class taught
Weaknesses: not enough quantitative homework

This course was amazing. Dr. Karato is an excellent engaging teacher with incredible knowledge in the topic area. The only thing that I think could be significantly improved is perhaps making the course more rigorous in terms of grading so that students don't treat it as a gut.
I would have liked more feedback on homework, but I enjoyed the material and lectures.
That lectures are more structured and less repetitive, and there is a plan at the beginning of each class saying what we will cover

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would only recommend this course if you are an EPS or astro/astrophysics major. I study geophysics and found the course interesting and helpful in my other studies, especially the first half of the course which focusses on space. If you do not have an intermediate knowledge of physics, do NOT take this course.
Yes. This is course brings a lot of interesting questions in planetary science to students. Highly recommend students who wants to study in Planetary Science in the future take it.
In an instant. This class is one of the most interesting classes I have ever taken and Dr. Karato is truly brilliant.
Yes! This course was one of a kind in content and I am very glad I was able to learn so much from it!
